definition.name: Copycat Action
definition.description: GitHub Action for copying files to other repositories
definition.author: André Storhaug

inputs.name: src_path
inputs.description: The source path to the file(s) or folder(s) to copy from

inputs.name: dst_path
inputs.description: The destination path to copy the file(s) or folder(s) to

inputs.name: dst_owner
inputs.description: The name of the owner of the repository to push to

inputs.name: dst_repo_name
inputs.description: The name of the repository to push to

inputs.name: src_branch
inputs.description: The branch name of the source repository

inputs.name: dst_branch
inputs.description: The branch name of the destination repository

inputs.name: clean
inputs.description: Set to true if the dst_path should be emptied before copying

inputs.name: file_filter
inputs.description: A glob pattern for filtering file names

inputs.name: filter
inputs.description: A glob pattern for filtering file paths to be included for copying

inputs.name: exclude
inputs.description: A glob pattern for excluding paths

inputs.name: src_wiki
inputs.description: Set to true if the source repository you want to copy from is the GitHub Wiki

inputs.name: dst_wiki
inputs.description: Set to true if the destination repository you want to copy from is the GitHub Wiki

inputs.name: username
inputs.description: The GitHub username to associate commits made by this GitHub action

inputs.name: email
inputs.description: The email used for associating commits made by this GitHub action

evidence.reasoning: The action is primarily focused on copying files between repositories, which relates to managing dependencies across projects. It also involves communication between repositories, hence the secondary category.
